column5: This master’s programme provides in-depth, interdisciplinary training in biochemical engineering as practiced in various contexts and sectors. Particular areas of focus include food science, biomedical sciences, pharmaceutical sciences, and environmental sciences. In addition to fundamental (bio)chemical and scientific coursework, the curriculum includes assignments in socio-economics and biotechnology.About the programmeThe Engineering Technology programme is currently being reformed. Changes to this programme may still be made in the course of the academic year.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
